page.title: 20PETROCKSTOWE FARM MACHINERY
page.content: There are no working horses on the 14 {Petrockstowe}farms, but{39 tractors, which with their many attachments do so much work,from ploughing to harvest & enable the large area to be farmed by so few people. One farmhouse dates back to l3th Century, 5 to the 17th & 3 to the 19th. There are at least 28 {cob outbuildings}still in everyday use - shippons, barns & looseboxes - but also plenty of traditional stone & numerous modern steel-frame buildings. Four farms do not have mains water, but there are 16 wells & many springs. Only 3 farms have a generator but 8 have a mechanical milking parlour & 10 have a roller mill. Most farms use outside contractors to shear and for ditching/drainage work. Milk is col- lected daily from farms by a tanker lorry. Seed, fertilisers & most equip- ment is bought from farm co-operatives
